description: There's no longer any doubt about it now: The great running-back mystery at Penn State has been solved. Joe Paterno figured it was solved a week ago Saturday when Curt Warner ran for 183 yards and three touchdowns against Boston College.

title: MOUNTAIN MEDICAL EQUIPMENT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
LEE ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
RISE OF THE KID FROM 49TH ST.
description: It was a bit awkward for both when Brian Mullen, a 20-year-old rookie, came to the Winnipeg Jets' training camp last month and saw Doug Soetaert, one of his new teammates. They knew each other in different roles. Three years earlier, Soetaert was a goalie for the Rangers, and Mullen, then a student at Power Memorial High School here, was a Ranger stick boy.

title: TEXAS INTERNATIONAL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Football Job Hunt
description: That was a strange scene at Giants Stadium over the weekend: no football game because of the strike, but a field packed with football players. They were there by invitation of the New Jersey Generals of the United States Football League, which opens its first season next March, and they were trying out for jobs.

title: GEOPHYSICAL SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Net income...C-Net income, including a tax credit of $550,000; the shr earnings amounts and shrs outstdng reflect a 3-for-2 stock divd payable on Jan 29 and a 2-for-1 stock split in Apr 1981

title: PIPER, JAFFRAY & HOPWOOD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Midwest Stock Exchange

title: Some Like It, Some Don't
description: T he hills are alive with the sound of the refrain: Will there be a pro football season this season? Seven weeks have passed since the slam of shoulder pads and the cracking of bones were last heard in National Football League games.

title: HELP BEYOND THE REACH OF MENTALLY ILL ELDERLY
description: To the Editor:

title: LESSON OF 1982: PERSONAL ATTACK AS A NECESSITY
description: Any number of columnists and candidates have decried the ''negative tone'' of the 1982 Congressional campaigns, as if the meanness that spewed from television sets and direct-mail envelopes was the result of some transient distemper brought on by the recession.

title: HYMAN WEINBERG
description: Hyman Weinberg, a partner in the investment banking and brokerage firm of Goldman, Sachs & Company, died yesterday at the New England Medical Center in Boston, after suffering a stroke while on a business trip to Boston. He was 47 years old, and was a resident of Kings Point, L.I.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Why is it that lumber in the ground, or in contact with the ground, will rot but potatoes will not?

title: SOME ANIMALS' TAILS ARE SOCIALLY SIGNIFICANT
description: TO biologists and zoologists, tails are ''subordinate organs or parts'' of living creatures. But to one kind of bird and to a species of lizard, tails are not just subordinate parts, taking a back seat to the rest of their bodies, but play important roles in their lives.

title: OUTBOARD MARINE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest periods include charge of about $10 million associated with moving and other costs and the yr-ago periods include charge of about $5 million also associated with moving and other costs

title: Bryant Overruled
description: The Alabama football team had just been upset by Louisiana State, 20-10, last Saturday, and there was a suggestion that Alabama's legendary coach, Paul (Bear) Bryant, was being outcoached and it might be time for him to retire. The suggestion came from Bryant himself, and he repeated it in his television show Sunday when he said, ''I think our players deserve better.'' Dr. Joab Thomas, the university president, said he had the utmost confidence in Bryant. Actually, Bryant must leave after next season because he will have reached the mandatory retirement age of 70.

title: Limited Seeks Roaman's
description: The Limited Inc., the women's apparel chain based in Columbus, Ohio, which bought control of Lane Bryant Inc. earlier this year, said yesterday that it would buy Roaman's Inc., a privately held retailer of women's apparel, for $6.5 million in cash and notes. Roaman's had sales last year of about $98 million.

title: HUNTINGTON HEALTH SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
NEW CARGO CARRIER ROLLS ON HIGHWAYS AS WELL AS ON RAILS
description: A new freight-hauling vehicle that rolls on both highways and railroads is carrying food and general merchandise between New York City and Buffalo.

title: INSTRON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: B-Net income; the yr-ago results were restated to reflect foreign currency translation accounting changes

title: DIAGNOSTIC RETRIEVAL SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BARRY, R G, CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Net income; latest 9 mos earnings includes $5.4 million charge from the women's shoe operations and a $1.3 million goodwill writeoff

title: Balanchine in Hospital To Recover From a Fall
description: George Balanchine, artistic director of the New York City Ballet, has entered Roosevelt Hospital at his own request to recover from a fall suffered in his apartment last week.

title: 26 Die in Thai Bus Accident
description: Twenty-six people were killed and 27 were injured when the driver of a bus tried to pass another bus and crashed head on into an oncoming 10-wheel truck, the police reported today. The accident took place in Saraburi Province, 60 miles north of Bangkok.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A chart in Business Day Saturday on sales of leading over-the-counter analgesics omitted figures for Exced- rin, a product of the Bristol-Myers Company. In 1981 Excedrin had $85 million in sales.

title: Cellular Phones
description: The Federal Communications Commission said it received hundreds of applications to build cellular mobile telephone systems, easily surpassing the number of applications received during the first round of licensing this summer.

title: Ex-Head at Los Alamos Testifies on Safety
description: A former laboratory director testified today that safety requirements were much less stringent when above-ground atomic tests began in Nevada because scientists worked under furious pressure to outstrip the Soviet Union.

title: PIC 'N' SAVE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
EDUCATION
description: ONE of these days soon, alongside the ubiquitous requests for donations to Channel 13, the New York Zoological Society and the American Museum of Natural History, there may be a plea for funds from a new source: the New York City public schools.

title: FIRST COLUMBIA FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company began independent operations following spin-off from MCA Inc on July 31

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Once More for Alma Mater

title: People
description: * Vincent Trovati has joined Sudler & Hennessy Inc., an affiliate of Young & Rubicam, as a senior vice president and group director.

title: Grooms Lose Plea
description: Does a horse's groom qualify as a ''sports participant,'' under the law? Four defendants in a Federal Court trial in Uniondale, L.I., argued no. In fact, on the strength of that argument, they asked the court to kill an indictment that charged them with conspiracy to fix six races at Yonkers and Roosevelt Raceways in 1978. They were accused of trying to inject certain horses with tranquilizers. They also were accused of trying to bribe horse grooms as part of the plan.

title: HARSCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The 1981 figures were restated to reflect changes in accounting method for depreciation and foreign currency translations

title: INTERNATIONAL BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The yr-ago results restated to reflect adoption of F.A.S.B. No 52

title: Laura B. Knebel, 64, A Former Look Editor
description: Laura Bergquist Knebel, an author and former editor and writer for Look magazine, was found dead Saturday at her home in Princeton, N.J. She was 64 years old.

title: Stock-Index Futures Post Trading Advances
description: Stock-index futures trading continues to grow faster than any other sector of the commodity market, outpacing even the rising turnover in interest rate and precious metals contracts. The growth is considered extraordinary because the oldest index futures contract has been traded for only eight months; in the commodities industry, it normally takes several years for a new contract to achieve investor acceptance.

title: SENATE G.O.P. SEEKS PUBLIC WORKS BILL WITH 20,000 JOBS
description: Senate Republican leaders have quietly ordered the drafting of a public works bill that could provide up to 200,000 jobs as a response to a jobs proposal by Democrats in the House of Representatives.

title: CONROY INC reports earnings for Yr to Aug 31
BEGIN TELLS PANEL HE WASN'T AWARE OF PHALANGE DRIVE
description: Prime Minister Menachem Begin said today that he had not been informed ahead of time that Christian militiamen were being sent by the Israeli Army into Palestinian camps in Beirut.

title: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 9, 1982; Markets
description: The stock market declined sharply as investors displayed disappointment on the Federal Reserve's failure to cut the discount rate. The Dow Jones industrial average fell 14.34 points, to 1,037.44. Analysts saw the decline as a temporary retreat after last week's 60-point advance. Volume dropped to 75.2 million shares. (Page D1.)

title: Fumes Still Puzzle As School Reopens
description: Classes resumed yesterday at Hauppauge High School on Long Island, after the school was closed last week because mysterious fumes forced the evacuation of the building and sent more than 50 students and teachers to local hospitals.

title: MODULINE INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Balloonist Giving Up His Dream
description: Maxie Anderson, whose third attempt to circle the earth in a 200-foot-tall balloon was scuttled today after a leak forced the craft to land, said he was abandoning his dream.

title: 4 Hall of Fame Entries At Art Directors Club
description: The four newest members of the Art Directors Club Hall of Fame will be formally inducted Friday at a dinner at the Pierre Hotel. They are Amil Gargano, the strong-willed preident and chief executive officer of Ally & Gargano, who started in the agency business with Campbell-Ewald in Detroit; Richard Avedon, the famed photographer who the club described as ''one of the most important innovators in our profession''; Massimo Vignelli, architect and designer, and the late Jerome Snyder, who was the first art dirctor of both Sports Illustrated and Scientific American.

title: Reynolds Using Black Insurers
description: SALEM, N.C., Nov. 8 (AP) - R.J. Reynolds Industries signed agreements with four of the nation's largest black-owned insurance companies for $300 million worth of employee group life insurance.

title: EXECUTIVES
description: * Armco Financial Corp., Middletown, Ohio, a unit of Armco Inc., has named Bernard L. Lavery president and chief executive officer.

title: BULOVA WATCH CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After a tax credit of $2,619,000...C-Net loss; the latest qr included pretax foreign exchange losses of $317,000 compared to $502,000 and pretax gains of $234,000 versus $110,000 on disposition of assets; the latest 9 mos included pretaxforeign exchange losses of $1,709,000 against $2,819,000 and pretax gains of $554,000 compared to $1,992,000 from asset dispositions

title: QUIXOTE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including an extraordinary charge of $125,000 on the writeoff of Arizona oil well and $54,000 for product development charge

title: Air Florida Sells Western Air Stake
description: Air Florida System said yesterday that it had disposed of its investment of 1,647,000 shares in Western Air Lines as part of a plan to restructure itself and to return to profitability by the first quarter of next year.

title: 5 Nations Will Defy Ban on Whaling
description: Japan, the Soviet Union and three other nations have filed objections to a worldwide ban on commercial killing of whales that goes into effect in 1986, the International Whaling Commission said today.

title: TECHNICAL TAPE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including income from discontinued operations of $901,000 for the qr and $895,000 for the 9 mos...C-Including income from discontinued operations of $486,000

title: CHAMBER MUSIC: BERG CONCERTO
description: TWO musical entities seemingly made for each other came together Sunday afternoon in Alice Tully Hall. One of these was a body of musicians -the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center - the other Berg's Chamber Concerto for Piano, Violin and 13 Winds.

title: Soviet Super-Bombers Seen Near U.S. Fleet
description: Soviet supersonic bombers, known in the West as Backfires, have made their first simulated missile strikes against United States aircraft carriers and started patrolling the Sea of Japan in what the Navy says adds ''a new dimension to the threat to the sea lanes.''

title: MDC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $1,074,000 from a gain on a land sale by a corporate joint venture in which the company had a one-half interest

title: EXTRAVAGANT CHARGES; Dress and Taxes
description: Nancy Reagan won't say how much she pays for Adolfo's sumptuous ballroom gowns, but at Saks Fifth Avenue they cost as much as $4,000. Moralists may see in this further proof of national decadence.

title: HORIZONS RESEARCH reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After a gain of $147,504 from discontinued operations...C-Net income...D-Includes a gain from discontinued operations of $3,599 for the qr and $40,942 for the 9 mos

title: BRACKEN EXPLORATION CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
GOVERNMENT'S STAR WITNESS HEARD LIVE AND ON TAPE AT TEAMSTER TRIAL
description: The prosecution put its star witness on the stand today in the bribery-conspiracy trial of Roy L. Williams, president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Unit of Elf Aquitaine Chooses a President
description: Gilbert M.A. Portal has been named president of the EA/TG Oil and Gas Company, part of the giant Elf Aquitaine oil group controlled by France.

title: SEX AND INSURANCE: EQUALITY JUST ISN'T FAIR
description: To the Editor:

title: Bill Offered to Soften Seoul News Restrictions
description: The major opposition party submitted a bill to the National Assembly today proposing revisions to the law on journalism it says hampers press freedom.

title: FLORIDA CAPITAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: The Best of the Finest

title: TAX IS CUT FOR BRITISH BUSINESSES
description: Business got some of the tax relief it had been seeking as Sir Geoffrey Howe, the Chancellor of the Exchequer, made the Government's annual fall economic presentation to Parliament here this afternoon.

title: FISCHER & PORTER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The 1981 figures reflect adoption of F.A.S.B. No 52

title: CONSUMER DEBT RISES $1.1 BILLION
description: The nation's consumers took on $1.1 billion more in new installment debt in September than they repaid, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: * Aluminum Co. of America filed a shelf registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $200 million of debt securities, to be issued from time to time with terms to be set at the time of sale.

title: MINERS' CAMPAIGN WINDS UP AND UNIONISTS BALLOT TODAY
description: With one of the United Mine Workers' bitterest campaigns ending today, union members will vote Tuesday to decide whether a burly former mine electrician or a union lawyer will lead them through the next five years and two crucial periods of negotiations.

title: COLONIAL PENN GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The 1981 results were restated

title: CRYSTAL OIL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After a gain of $385,000 from discontinued operations...C-Net income includesa gain of $1,355,000 from discontinued operations

title: F.B.I. Expert Links Rifle To Murder of Judge
description: A ballistics expert testified today that the shot that killed Federal Judge John H. Wood could have come from a Weatherby Mark V rifle purchased by one of the suspects 12 days before the slaying.

title: Honduras Cuts Ship Registry
description: The Honduran Navy announced today that it was canceling the registrations of 500 ships that use its colors as a flag of convenience because of unspecified illegal acts. It said foreign ships under its flag had been used for illegal traffic of all kinds and had given Honduras a bad name.

title: DAMON CREATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
LEBANESE SHIFTING VIEW OF MASSACRE
description: Reluctantly, painfully and with a sense of guilt, more and more Lebanese, both Moslems and Christians, are beginning to admit that Lebanese Phalangist militiamen were probably the killers in the massacre at the Palestinian refugee camps in West Beirut in September.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Brief Encounter

title: TV: 'THE SCARLET PIMPERNEL' RETURNS
description: THE setting is Paris in 1792 and, as the opening graphics tell us, The Terror Begins. Moaning in agony, members of royalty and the clergy wait in a dark prison to be summoned to the guillotine. Outside, the filthy rabble keeps shouting, ''Death to the aristocrats!'' and ''Long live the Republic!''

title: U.S. Acts to Halt Drilling In New Mexico Preserve
description: The Interior Department today asked the United States Attorney in New Mexico to obtain an injunction requiring the Yates Oil Company to halt drilling operations in the Salt Creek Wilderness in the Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge near Roswell, N.M.

title: SOCCER, SOCCER EVERYWHERE
description: Robert Hendrick sees winds of change blowing across the playing fields of this country that he frankly finds unsettling: all of these boys running around in soccer shorts when they should be playing football.

title: POPULATION DROP PREDICTED IN U.S.
description: The population of the United States will reach a high of 309 million in the year 2050 and then will start to decline, according to projections issued today by the Census Bureau.

title: De Lorean Asset Sale Delayed
description: A Federal bankruptcy judge today adjourned a hearing on an offer to acquire the assets of the De Lorean Motor Company after a new, higher offer for those assets was made in court here.

title: Landlord Charged With Tax Fraud
description: A Manhattan psychiatrist was arrested yesterday on charges that he had fraudulently obtained $249,000 in housing tax abatements from the city.

title: AT THE END OF THE STAYED COURSE
description: To the Editor:

title: BRIEFING
description: A Political Switch

title: Bridge: Blackwood Seems Simple, But That Can Be an Illusion
description: On first acquaintance, the world's most famous bridge convention seems of exquisite simplicity. Easley Blackwood, still hale and hearty at the age of 79, invented his famous ace-asking device as far back as 1933, and there was only one tricky part: A five-club response could show not only an absence of aces but also the improbable holding of four aces.

title: CANADIAN PACIFIC LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Dodgers Recall A Perfectionist
description: When Steve Garvey was born in 1948, Billy DeLury was working for the Brooklyn Dodgers in Ebbets Field. When Steve Garvey grew up and played 1,107 games in a row as the Los Angeles Dodgers' first baseman, Billy DeLury was the traveling secretary.

title: EXCERPTS FROM BEGIN'S TESTIMONY BEFORE PANEL ON WEST BEIRUT MASSACRE
description: Following are excerpts from the testimony of Prime Minister Menachem Begin before the state commission of inquiry into the Beirut massacre, as translated by The New York Times from the Hebrew. The members of the commission are Yitzhak Kahan, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court; Aharon Barak, Supreme Court Justice, and Yona Efrat, retired major general of the army.

title: IMPROVISING WAS THE KEY TO 2 POINTS
description: T he play had never been rehearsed. The halfback lined up in the wrong place and the opposing team's defensive end lined up in the less preferred place. The offensive linemen were unsure of whom to block. The quarterback threw his pass a little behind the receiver, who fell to catch the football, then bobbled it but held on.

title: BAYLESS, A J, MARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 9
OUR NEW FISCAL CRISIS
description: New York City is not experiencing a repeat of the budget emergency of 1975, but there is no doubt that this is a serious fiscal crisis - the medicine for which may be just as painful as the earlier doses of austerity.

title: ACID RAIN REPORT SEEN AS WARNING
description: A new report by Environmental Protection Agency scientists shows that a much larger portion of the country than previously realized is susceptible to damage by acid rain, a leading environmental group warned today.

title: HOSPITAL TRYING TO BUY 5 ACRES OF BAKER FIELD
description: Presbyterian Hospital has begun discussing with Columbia University the purchase of five acres of the university's Baker Field sports complex in northern Manhattan as the site for a new 300-bed community hospital, university and hospital officials said yesterday.

title: VIRCO MANUFACTURING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 8
'OLD' DOESN'T MEAN 'POOR'
description: When Congress finally takes up the debate over the future of Social Security, as it must do soon, it ought to consider some recent research developed by John Shoven and myself at the National Bureau of Economic Research. Our findings suggest that the elderly have not become poorer as a result of the last decade's high inflation, as is widely believed, but have actually become richer relative to the rest of the population, at least in terms of income. Accordingly, Congress should distinguish between ''elderly poor'' and ''elderly rich'' in the allocation of benefits.

title: New Flights to Go To Atlantic City
description: Allegheny Commuter will fly twice daily between Atlantic City and New York City, beginning next Monday, airline officials announced today.

title: Murcer to Columbus
description: After 16 seasons as a major leaguer, Bobby Murcer has wound up on a minor league roster. Murcer confirmed yesterday that he had given the Yankees permission to assign him to their Columbus farm team in the International League.

title: Body of Belgian Aide Found
description: A body found Sunday near the Golden Gate Bridge was identified today as that of Rene Thimister, 66 years old, an honorary consul-general of Belgium who had been missing for two weeks, the coroner's office reported.

title: Hart Schaffner & Marx Mapping a New Strategy
description: Hart Schaffner & Marx plans to change its name next year - to the Hartmarx Corporation - and Jerome S. Gore, the company's chairman and chief executive, has a new strategy to sell men's suits.

title: AN ADMINISTRATION SOLD ON CLEAN WATER
description: To the Editor:

title: Ferro Stock Deal
description: The Ferro Corporation said it had bought 1,733,200 shares of its common stock from the Crane Company for $31.03 each. After recovery of Crane's short-term profits, Ferro said, its net cost will be reduced to $30.30 a share. The purchase was financed through existing lines of credit, it said.

title: BEVERLY HILLS SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN (CALIF) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept
CARLING O'KEEFE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Nigeria Dockworkers Strike
description: Nigeria's 30,000 dockworkers went on strike today for the third time in six months to back demands for more pay, port officials said.

title: MUSIC: TERESA BERGANZA AND PAREJO
description: THE word ''recital'' in English has a somewhat drab connotation for those old enough to have gone to school when memorization was a chore that could not be alloted to a computer. It summons up an image of schoolboys making their way through ''The Chambered Nautilus'' or ''Trees'' or Portia's ''mercy'' speech. In music, it often turns out to mean something almost as mechanical: too many soloists nowadays think they have accomplished something when they plow through programs learned by rote and delivered with pointless accuracy.

title: PETTIBONE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Escapes From Eastern Bloc To Bavaria Are Reported Up
description: There have been many more escapes from East Germany and Czechoslovakia to the south German state of Bavaria this year than last, the Bavarian border guards reported today.

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Nets, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P.M. After five straight defeats, Coach Hubie Brown is trying to put together a combination of guards who will lead the Knicks to their first victory of the season.

title: COGNITRONICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
INDIA, ONCE A GIANT IN SCIENCE, TRIES TO REKINDLE THE CREATIVE FIRE
description: NEW DELHI ONCE, when the Roman Empire was dying, and much of classical learning lay in ashes, and the Dark Ages were descending on the West, there flourished on the plains of northern India not only the most civilized culture of its time, but also one of the most creative in history.

title: INDAL LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
LOEWS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After net realized invest losses of $15,393,000 for the qr and $13,691,000 for the 9 mos...C-After net realized invest losses of $5,515,000...D-After net realized invest losses of $23,937,000 and a charge of $3,842,000 primarily from disc oper of unconsolidated affiliates;the yr-ago 9 mos net from continuing oper of$192,935,000 includes a gain of $58,296,000 on sale of hotel property & certainsubsidiaries; the rev of $82,917,000 from these oper is included in its total yr-ago 9 mos rev;yr-ago qr & 9 mos figures were restated for accounting change

title: Bill Ferguson, 85, Was Coach At St. Joseph's for 25 Years
description: Bill Ferguson, basketball coach at St. Joseph's College in Philadelphia from 1928 to 1953, died Saturday night after a brief illness.

title: High Court Backs Tax Protest Curb
description: The Supreme Court left intact today a legal limitation in New York City and Nassau County on property owners who challenge their tax assessments.

title: Haze From Siberia
description: A possible source has been identified for the ''Arctic haze'' that has dimmed Alaskan skies in recent winters. It is the large mining and ore-smelting complex that was developed in the Soviet Union at Norilsk, in the Siberian Arctic, during the 1970's.

title: PITTWAY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Chrysler Lays Off 2,500 At 15 U.S. Factories
description: About 2,500 United States autoworkers were laid off by Chrysler today because of a strike by Canadian workers. A company spokesman said more such layoffs were possible later in the week.

title: Trial Set for Jan. 10 in Slaying Of Four on Hudson River Pier
description: The trial of Donald Nash, who is charged with the slaying of three CBS technicians and a Federal witness last April, has been scheduled for Jan. 10 in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: DE LOREAN PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO DEALING IN COCAINE
description: John Z. De Lorean today pleaded not guilty to a nine-count Federal indictment charging him with cocaine trafficking and racketeering.

title: News Summary; TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 9, 1982
description: International Menachem Begin told the panel investigating the killings of hundreds of Palestinian civilians in refugee camps in Beirut that he had not been informed in advance that Christian militiamen were being sent into the camps by the Israeli Army. The Prime Minister testified under oath he learned of the operation only after it was under way. (Page A1, Column 6.) More and more Lebanese, both Moslems and Christians, are beginning to admit that Christian Phalangist militiamen were probably the killers of Palestinian civilians in the West Beirut camps. The Lebanese Government contends that the Phalangists had no role in the slayings. (A1:5.)

title: Help From a Fumble
description: John Witkowski, the Columbia quarterback, broke the N.C.A.A. Division I-AA record last Saturday for total offense in one game. No one knew about it until long after the game because it took a statistical rules interpretation to get the record.

title: REAGAN BEGINS CABINET MEETINGS ON CRUCIAL 1984 BUDGET DECISIONS
description: President Reagan, facing what his aides said was one of the most agonizing set of budget decisions since World War II, today accelerated his review of steps to reduce the budget deficit, projected at nearly $200 billion for the fiscal year 1984.

title: Brent Petitions For Chapter 11
description: Brent Petroleum Industries said its United States subsidiary, Brent Explorations Inc., had filed for protection under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Act.

title: HOW DOES POWER AFFECT THE POWERFUL?
description: IT happens continually: People gain power; others lose it. When power changed hands during last week's elections, most of those who lost tried to put a good face on defeat. But Toby Moffett, the Connecticut Congressman, was candid about the pain.

title: LENNOX MOAK
description: Lennox Moak, who served as city finance director under two mayors and was closely allied with former Mayor Frank Rizzo, died today at Chestnut Hill Hospital after suffering cardiac arrest Saturday.

title: SYSTEMS PLANNING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
24 CLUBS OPPOSED
description: The New Orleans Saints' players, who have often been critical of union bargaining tactics during negotiations to reach a new labor agreement, voted overwhelmingly yesterday to accept in principle the latest contract offer made by the National Football League's Management Council to the N.F.L. Players Association.

title: MOTT'S SUPER MARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Waterford Park May Close in '83
description: Waterford Park, one of West Virginia's two thoroughbred race tracks, has lost a million dollars this year, and a permanent shutdown is possible after next year's season, its general manager said today.

title: POPE WILL VISIT POLAND NEXT JUNE, WARSAW AND PRIMATE ANNOUNCE
description: Poland's military ruler and its Roman Catholic Primate announced today that Pope John Paul II would visit his homeland in June.

title: AMERICAN MONITOR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Restated to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split as of May 24, 1982

title: Advertising; Cautious Optimism At A.N.A.
description: ''And to think, 12 years ago I was working for a company that didn't advertise,'' mused John H. Dowd, who today was elected chairman of the Association of National Advertisers.

title: SONGS: AVSHALOM ZFIRA, TENOR
description: WHILE listening to the tenor Avshalom Zfira sing Hebrew art songs, traditional Eastern European music and contemporary folk music from Israel at Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night, one couldn't help wondering why - outside of specialty evenings like this one - so little of this literature is heard in the concert hall. That's because although the texts were in Hebrew or Yiddish rather than the standard romance languages, a good amount of the material was secular, and almost all of it was both appealing and attractively written for the tenor voice.

title: Books Of The Times
description: MATTERS OF CHANCE. By Gail Albert. 254 pages. Putnam. $14.95. MY OLD SWEETHEART. By Susanna Moore. 211 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $12.95.

title: THE MEASURE OF ALAIN DE ROTHSCHILD
description: To the Editor:

title: MOORE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: All figures are in U.S. funds

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: REMEMBER WHEN?

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: The Last Campaign Ad

title: FAR WEST FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
RECITAL: PETER ORTH, PIANIST, AT THE Y
description: PETER ORTH'S piano recital at the 92d Street Y on Sunday operated for most of the afternoon on a steady level of muscular integrity, determined clarity and musical good sense. When he turned to Liszt, however, Mr. Orth rose higher.

title: 4 ASTRONAUTS ARRIVE AT CAPE FOR SHUTTLE LAUNCHING
description: The four astronauts who will fly the next mission of the space shuttle Columbia arrived here today as preparations proceeded smoothly toward a scheduled launching at 7:19 A.M. Thursday.

title: PITTSBURGH BREWING CO. HIRES EX-GIMBELS MAN
description: After Harvey Sanford was replaced in July as chairman and chief executive officer of Gimbels Pittsburgh, the retailing executive told friends he had ''something brewing.'' Yesterday he was named president and chief executive officer of the Pittsburgh Brewing Company, maker of Iron City beer.

title: AROUND THE WORLD
description: The State Department expressed concern today over Iraq's decision to offer a haven to Abu Nidal, a 43-year old Palestinian described here as a ''known international terrorist.''

title: SECONDARY MOTIVE DEPICTED AT TEAMSTER TRIAL
description: Testimony in the bribery conspiracy trial of Roy L. Williams, president of the teamsters union, suggested for the first time today that Mr. Williams and his four co-defendants might have hoped to gain in more than one way by doing a favor for Senator Howard W. Cannon: by obtaining his help in Congress and, incidentally, by making a profit on the deal.

title: WHERE TO BUY GAME, WILD AND LESS SO
description: Courtenay Beinhorn is a Texas-born writer who has cooked and eaten game since childhood.

title: WIRE BASKETS FOR FOOD
description: FOR many years, European women have carried their personal wicker or wire baskets to the marketplace while shopping. A familiar sight in rural France to this day is the shopper strolling through a village with her basket overflowing with provisions for that day's meal - and always a long baguette sticking out of the middle like an antenna, often with the very top nibbled off. The ubiquitous waterproof, leakproof plastic sack is slowly replacing that traditional basket in some places, but somehow fresh food seems to deserve a better vehicle.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Stress and Insomnia

title: MUSIC: TENNSTEDT LEADS MAHLER THIRD
description: THE one thing that can be said confidently about Mahler's Third Symphony is that it is a long trip. Commentators are fond of pointing out that its first movement alone is longer than Beethoven's entire Fifth Symphony. Played without intermission, as it was last night at Carnegie Hall by the Philadelphia Orchestra, the Mahler runs more than an hour and a half, putting both musicians and their listeners to extreme tests of concentration. Faced with such a journey, the conductor needs to have a detailed plan. He cannot just throw a few things in a bag and be off.

title: TRANSCON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including income from continuing operations of $632,000 and after a loss of $341,000 from discontinued operations...C-Net income including income from discontinued operations of $33,000 for the qr and $18,000 for the 9 mos and extraordinary credits of $8,393,000 for the qr and the 9 mos...D-After a loss of $785,000 from discontinued operations and income of $1,196,000 from an extraordinary credi

title: TEXAS, THIS BEER BOTTLE IS FOR YOU
description: The three cowhands are tough-looking, as if they might be waiting to ambush the Marlboro Man, who occupies a billboard just up the freeway from their sign.

title: Colt Layoff Grows
description: Colt Firearms will lay off 180 production workers this week because of slowing orders for guns.

title: N.F.L. BRINGS NEW COMPLAINT
description: The National Football League Management Council filed an unfair labor practice charge against the N.F.L. Players Association yesterday, contending that a player representative had been threatened for publicly opposing union bargaining tactics.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''To be very blunt, we now see that unless there is dramatic action, the United States will experience an unprecedented series of deficits during the years ahead.

title: BLACK VOTE A FACTOR IN INCREASED TURNOUT IN OFF-YEAR ELECTION
description: Rising partisan rivalry in the South, an increased black vote and polarization over unemployment stimulated the relatively high turnout in last Tuesday's voting, reversing a 20-year national trend of declining voter participation in midterm elections, according to voting specialists.

title: ACADEMY INSURANCE GROUP INC reports earnings for QTr to Sept 30
SHORTCUT JUDGING CONSUMER COMPLAINTS
description: To the Editor:

title: GENERAL REFRACTORIES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including a pretax gain of $1,903,000 from land sales and a p of $208,000 from foreign currency translations...C-Including a of $1,258,000 from land sales, a pretax loss of $375,000 from t ment of litigation and a provision of $2 million for a pretax l foreign unit...D-Including a pretax gain of $5,668,000 from la pretax gain of $53,000 from foreign currency translations and a of $800,000 from an investment in an affiliate...E-Including a of $3,719,000 from land sales, a pretax loss of $704,000 from f rency translations, a pretax loss of $375,000 from the settlem litigation and a provision of $2 mil for a pretax loss on a for

title: Witness Ties Warner Chief to Secret Cash Fund
description: A former executive of Warner Communications testified in a fraud trial yesterday that Steven J. Ross, the company's chairman, had suggested that an official of the Westchester Premier Theater might be ''helpful'' with a secret cash fund at Warner.

title: COAST SCHOOL ATHLETES MUST HOLD C AVERAGE
description: All students will have to maintain a C average to participate in extracurricular activities, including athletics, under a new policy approved by the Los Angeles Board of Education.

title: VICON INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fire in Angola Parliament
description: Fire has badly damaged the temporary home of Angola's Parliament in Luanda, the capital, the official Angolan press agency said today.

title: 9-Digit ZIP Is Delayed
description: The board of governors of the United States Postal Service postponed action today on a nine-digit ZIP code because of a highly critical unpublished report on the innovation by the General Accounting Office.

title: NEW KOCH DEPUTY STARTS HIS CITY HALL ORIENTATION
description: Kenneth Lipper went on the job at City Hall yesterday, 53 days before he goes on the municipal payroll as Deputy Mayor for Finance and Economic Development.

title: Don't Strangle Chrysler
description: Some 10,000 Chrysler workers, bitter over their failure to win an immediate wage increase, have struck the company's six Canadian plants. They are just a small fraction of the company's total work force, but the strike will soon force a shutdown of Chrysler's U.S. plants. At best that would drain the company of cash badly needed for product development and at worst drive it into bankruptcy. The soundest hope is for intervention by the Canadian Government.

title: ACTORS ELECT ASNER'S SLATE
description: Activist candidates backed by Edward Asner have been elected to the Screen Actors Guild board of directors, defeating the more conservative ticket supported by Charlton Heston.

title: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 10, 1982; International
description: The U.S. and its allies have all but agreed on a trade policy that will allow the removal of sanctions against companies involved in the Soviet pipeline, according to Administration officials. They said France wants publicity about the agreement held to a minimum so it does not appear to have made any concessions. (Page A1.)

title: 3 WILL STUDY ALTERNATIVES TO THE LEGAL AID SOCIETY
description: Mayor Koch appointed three lawyers yesterday to study the feasibility of replacing the Legal Aid Society as the primary representative of poor people charged with crimes in New York City.

title: 2 FOR NYSTROM
description: The upswing that the Islanders started Sunday against the Philadelphia Flyers continued tonight as they defeated the St. Louis Blues, 4-1, in Nassau Coliseum.

title: GAS TAX URGED BY ROSTENKOWSKI FOR ROAD REPAIRS
description: Representative Dan Rostenkowski, the chief tax writer in the House, declared today that Congress must raise the Federal gasoline tax next year by 5 cents a gallon to pay for ''the massive reparation of the nation's bridges and roads.'' The tax now is 4 cents a gallon.

title: BRIEFING
description: Special-Interest Tally

title: HAMILTON BROTHERS PETROLEUM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Turkey's Top General Becomes Its President
description: Gen. Kenan Evren, Turkey's military leader, who was overwhelmingly elected President last Sunday, officially assumed his new office today, a Government statement said.

title: Wickes Reserve
description: The Wickes Companies said it anticipated taking a reserve of about $75 million in the fiscal third quarter for losses and expenses to be incurred in disposing of or closing its Aldens catalogue subsidiary. Wickes, which described itself as ''still in business'' and continuing ''to service our customers,'' last week retained Salomon Brothers Inc. to find a buyer for Aldens, which has incurred losses to date in 1982 and expects losses for the rest of the year.

title: John J. Tynan, 84, Dies; Ex-Connecticut Official
description: John J. Tynan, former Connecticut Commissioner of Motor Vehicles and a Democratic leader in the state for many years, died Monday at the Queens Convalescent Hospital in Middletown, Conn. He was 84 years old and had lived in Middletown all his life.

title: SHOULD LIBEL RULE FOR PUBLIC FIGURES BE CHANGED
description: For nearly two decades, the press has operated under a legal rule that shields it from libel suits by people in the public eye. Essentially, the rule says these public figures cannot win unless they can prove not only that the offending article was false but also that the publication acted with ''actual malice'' because it either knew that the story was false or recklessly disregarded the truth.

title: BECTON DICKINSON & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
SPEX INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
NOVELIST, CRITIC, AND JOURNALIST
description: Frank Swinnerton, 98, a British novelist whose career spanned more than 70 years, died Saturday in a hospital in Surrey, England. Mr. Swinnerton wrote about 60 novels - ''I haven't the faintest idea of the exact number,'' he told a correspondent of The New York Times a few years ago. The first one was ''The Merry Heart'' in 1908; the last, written in 1979, was ''Old Man With Three Daughters.''

title: Fears of a Rookie Runner
description: H e decided to run the first race in his life after witnessing the New York City Marathon last month. He felt such admiration for the ordinary sizes and shapes plodding home in four or five hours that he wanted some version of that feeling.

title: '718' Is Like Calling Scranton
description: The telephone company, a friend from Brooklyn notes glumly, contemplates a disturbing step: to assign a new area code to that borough, along with Queens and Staten Island.

title: News Summary; WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 10, 1982
description: International A way toward revoking the sanctions imposed by President Reagan on companies that take part in construction of the Soviet natural gas pipeline has been devised, according to Washington officials. They said the Administration would be able to end the sanctions under a new policy for East-West economic relations virtually agreed upon by the United States and its European allies. (Page A1, Col. 6.) The American envoy to El Salvador has been ordered to refrain from making public criticism of human rights abuses by Salvadoran security forces, according to Reagan Administration officials. The Ambassador, Deane R. Hinton, had assailed the Salvadoran legal system and acts of violence by right-wing extremists. (A1:4-5.)

title: LINGERIE EXHIBITION: VANITY'S DISTORTIONS
description: ASAGA of human frailty and vanity was unveiled in the Galleries of the Fashion Institute of Technology when a major exhibition, ''The Undercover Story,'' opened yesterday.

title: 6 ARRESTED IN 3 ROBBERIES IN CITY SUBWAY STATIONS
description: Six persons ranging in age from 15 to 24 were arrested by transit police officers and charged with robbing five passengers and pistolwhipping three of them in three incidents in Manhattan subway stations early yesterday.

title: Advertising; Anheuser's Interest In Cable
description: Anheuser-Busch, the country's largest brewery, has given up hope of a settlement of the football strike, according to Thomas Sharbaugh, group marketing manager and a panelist today at the Association of National Advertisers meeting here at the Breakers Hotel.

title: JACLYN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Max Leavitt, of Stage; Founded Opera Group
description: Max Leavitt, an actor, director, producer and founder of the Lemonade Opera company in the late 1940's, died Sunday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: HARVESTER CHOOSES NEW CHIEF OFFICER
description: Donald D. Lennox, the 63-year-old president and chief operating officer of the struggling International Harvester Company, has been elected to the additional post of chief executive officer. Mr. Lennox was chosen to succeed Louis W. Menk, 64, who will remain chairman and chairman of the board's executive committee,

title: BOLAR PHARMACEUTICAL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
WESTERN STATES LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
ALGOMA CENTRAL RAILWAY reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Yr-ago results have been restated

title: KOCH NOW DOUBTS NEED FOR CITY LAYOFFS
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that New York City could probably balance its budget this year and next without laying off any workers. However, the Mayor, in a day of statements on the subject that left even some of his own aides uncertain of his position, stopped short of promising that no layoffs would occur. He said he reserved the right to dismiss workers as a ''last resort.''

title: LAWYER, 33, BEATS INCUMBENT FOR MINE UNION'S PRESIDENCY
description: A young challenger for the presidency of the United Mine Workers, Richard L. Trumka, swept to a resounding victory tonight over the 46-year-old incumbent, Sam M. Church Jr.

title: FROM OBSCURITY TO THE NO. 1 RUSHER
description: The leading rusher in college football is a little-known junior on a team that has a 2-4-2 record. As a Texas schoolboy, he was considered too small by most college recruiters. One year ago, he was primarily a blocking back on a team that was hard pressed to score.

title: TORTUOUS ROAD TO NAMIBIAN INDEPENDENCE
description: To the Editor:

title: Comings and Goings
description: Whitney Tower has been named president of the National Museum of Racing in Saratoga Springs, N.Y., taking a post first held 32 years ago by his uncle, Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney. Tower replaces Charles E. Mather 2d, who died Oct. 26 after serving in the post for eight years. ... Harry Keough, who led St. Louis University to five national soccer titles in 16 years as coach, has resigned, citing an inability to motivate the team. St. Louis had a 9-7-2 record this year, the worst record in Keough's tenure. ... The Yankees have released Dave LaRoche, the 34-year-old left-handed reliever who between shuttles from Columbus to New York last season posted a 4-2 record and a 3.42 earned run average in 25 games with the Yankees. ... Al Hrabosky, who was released by the Atlanta Braves several months ago, has been invited to their 1983 training camp.

title: OTB Deserves to Expand
description: To the Editor:

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: EMPIRE OF SIGNS. By Roland Barthes. Translated by Richard Howard. 110 pages. Hill & Wang. $12.95.

title: TEXAS OIL & GAS CORP reports earnings for Yr to Aug 31
CORRECTIONS
description: A listing last Thursday of the members of the House of Representatives for 1983 incorrectly named the winners in two Virginia districts. The Fifth District will be represented by Dan Daniel and the Sixth by James Olin. Both are Democrats.

title: VISTA RESOURCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including a pretax gain of $804,312 on disposition of a plant...C-Including apretax deduction of $130,000 in expenses of an unconsummated tender offer...D-Including a pretax gain of $804,312 on disposition of a plant, and after a loss of $264,279 representing equity in net loss of a 50 percent owned company

title: Reagan's Man In Bonn
description: The best spokesman for the United States in Europe these days is Arthur Burns, former chairman of the Federal Reserve Board and now, at the age of 77, President Reagan's Ambassador to West Germany.

title: Swiss Obtain Release Of an American in Iran
description: An American citizen has been released from an Iranian prison where he spent two and a half years without trial on spying charges, the Swiss authorities said today.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: Ban Sought on Sulfites

title: CYPRIOT OMISSION
description: To the Editor:

title: THE REGION
description: Republican State Senators, outnumbered 26 to 13 by the Democrats, voted, 7 to 6, today to change their leadership for the legislative session that starts Jan. 5 by naming Philip S. Robertson as their minority leader.

title: LEONARD RETIRES FROM RING
description: Less than six years after he had made his professional debut in the building, Sugar Ray Leonard announced tonight the end of his career, one of the most brilliant in boxing history.

title: F.C.& B. and D.D.B.  Report Their Results
description: Foote, Cone & Belding Communications and Doyle Dane Bernbach International, which are ranked Nos.7 and 8 respectively in gross United States income, reported third-quarter results yesterday.

title: BENEFICIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of$85.9 million for the qr and $109.7 million for the 9 mos...C-After losses from discontinued operations of $46.1 million for the qr and $57.4 million for the 9 mos; yr-ago results have been restated for the sale of First Texas Financial Corp which was completed earlier this month

title: Kodak Introduces a New Movie Film
description: The Eastman Kodak Company introduced a motion picture film with a magnetic surface that it said could cut post-production costs in half.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: Many years ago, the Seamen's Church Institute would send small boats out into New York City's harbor to pick up sailors and bring them to their building for social events. It was a fact universally acknowledged that sailors on shore were likely to be plied with liquor by those women known as ladies of the night, and that they would then be robbed.

title: Judge Asked to Halt Drilling On Preserve in New Mexico
description: The Federal Government today asked a Federal district judge to halt an oil company's drilling of a natural gas well on a Government preserve in southeast New Mexico.

title: RULES SET ON INTEREST WITHHELD
description: Government regulations announced today would let taxpayers avoid having taxes withheld from their interest and dividends by dividing their savings and investments among several small accounts.

title: AM CABLE TV reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Heileman Raises Bid for Pabst
description: The G. Heileman Brewing Company sweetened its bid for control of the Pabst Brewing Company yesterday to $27.50 a share from the $25 announced on Friday. It would total about $151.3 million.

title: SALUTE OPENING FOR VIETNAM VETERANS
description: Two couples stood in front of the new Vietnam war memorial this morning. ''And where was your son?'' one man asked. ''He was killed just south of Saigon,'' another replied. ''Mine was killed three weeks before he was to get out,'' said the first man. ''Sad,'' said one of the women, shaking her head. ''Sad,'' said another. Then Ward and Maxine Holzheimer snapped a picture of Jack and Tawanah Farley in front of the stark black granite monument that listed the names of their dead sons.

title: Careers; Women As Senior Executives
description: WOMEN make up an increasing number of senior managers in large American corporations, a fact recently documented. Announcing results of a survey based on responses from 300 top women executives, Richard M. Ferry, president of Korn/Ferry International, said, ''We couldn't have conducted a survey of top woman executives five years ago.'' In 1979, when the management recruiting firm did a study of top managers, there were responses from 1,700 men and 8 women.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: 1.5 Million Back Copies And the Electronic Age

title: SYM-TEK SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Bank Acquisition
description: The Union National Corporation of Pittsburgh said it had agreed in principle to acquire McDowell National Bank of Sharon, Pa., for $27 million in cash. The banking concern said it would pay $53.65 a share for McDowell, which would become a wholly owned subsidiary, subject to approval of McDowell shareholders. McDowell has total assets of $284 million, while Union National Bank of Pittsburgh, Union National's principal subsidiary, has $1.4 billion in assets.

title: Japanese Hurt in Costa Rica
description: Teshuji Kosuga, the Japanese manager of the Matsushita Electric Company in Costa Rica, received a bullet wound in the neck when the police rescued him from five assailants who had kidnapped him today, a police spokesman said. A policeman and two kidnappers were also wounded.

title: Man Held in Attack On the Holtzmans
description: A 24-year-old man being held in the Mens Detention Center on Rikers Island awaiting trial on burglary charges was brought to Brooklyn Criminal Court and charged with assaulting the parents of Brooklyn District Attorney Elizabeth Holtzman and robbing their home on Aug. 5, the police said.

title: ROYAL NOD FOR EXHIBIT ON SWEDEN
description: ''Why, I've never seen anything like that before,'' King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden said yesterday as he peered at an artifact in the Museum of American Folk Art.

title: LEBANESE LEADER GETS NEW POWERS
description: The Lebanese Parliament gave the administration of President Amin Gemayel the power today to rule the nation by decree for six months.

title: DORMITORY AUTHORITY EXPECTS TO RECOVER MOST OF ITS LOSES
description: The New York State Dormitory Authority announced an agreement yesterday under which it would recover most of the $239 million it lost from investments with a securities concern that filed for bankruptcy. The settlement is expected to be signed today.

title: KELLY SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
WEDNESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Knicks, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, East Rutherford, N.J., 7:30 P.M. Albert King's 19.7-point average leads the Nets in scoring, but he has also given up 36 points to Julius Erving and 38 to Larry Bird. And now he has to face his talented brother, Bernard, for the second consecutive night. (Television -Sports@Channel and WHT, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WVNJ, 620; 7:30 P.M.) Hockey Rangers vs. St. Louis Blues, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P.M. This is the only visit this season of Emile (The Cat) Francis's Blues. Vaclav Nedomansky, the center whom Francis claimed from the Rangers on waivers several weeks ago, has been playing well for St. Louis. (Television -MSG Cable, 7:30 P.M., live, and 1 A.M., tape. Radio -WNEW, 1130; 7:30 P.M.) Devils vs. Washington Capitals, at Landover, Md. The Devils have not won in 10 games but would rather think on the positive side and say they're unbeaten in three, all ties. (Television - Channel 9, 8 P.M., tape. Radio - WVNJ-FM, 100.3; 7:30 P.M.) Indoor Soccer Arrows vs. Los Angeles Lazers, at Inglewood, Calif. The recently sold Arrows are playing their second game of the season in the realigned, 14-team Major Indoor Soccer League. They are the only champions in the league's four-year history, and they still have the standout scorers Steve Zungul and Fred Grgurev. (Television - USA Cable, 10:30 P.M.) Other Events Harness Racing: Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M. Freehold (N.J.) Raceway, noon.

title: Surgeon General Sees Danger in Video Games
description: The United States Surgeon General, Dr. C. Everett Koop, said today that video games might be hazardous to the health of young people, who, he said, are becoming addicted to the machines ''body and soul.''

title: PARENTS-TO-BE GET WORD ON BABIES FROM THOSE WHO KNOW
description: IT was not one of those upper East Side cocktail parties where everyone asks, ''What do you do?'' Since half the couples were expecting babies, the question of the hour was, ''When are you due?''

title: METROPOLITAN DIARY
description: ON a recent evening Carolyn White of Manhattan boarded one of the Japanese Hino buses that have been plying city streets for many months. ''For the first time, I had a chance to contemplate the emergency exit directions,'' she says. They read: WINDOW UNLOCKER IN EMERGENCY OPERATION IN EMERGENCY 1.RELEASE LOCK PUSHING BUTTONS IN BOTH SIDE 2.PUSH OUT SIDE WINDOWS OPEN

title: POPE, IN SPAIN, URGES EUROPE TO BE 'BEACON OF CIVILIZATION'
description: From this place of pilgrimage at Europe's western edge, Pope John Paul II issued an impassioned appeal today for the continent to recover its ancient soul and put it at the service of humanity, irrespective of political divisions.

title: U.S. Gets Pele's Vote
description: The World Cup in soccer in 1986 should be held in the United States rather than Brazil, Pele says.

title: ATICO FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
WASHINGTON NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
MARSH SUPERMARKETS reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 16
description: B-AFter gain on disposition of certain drug stores of $1,080,000

title: Inmate Said to Link Blaze to His Cigarette
description: A mentally troubled inmate says that two other prisoners slipped him a lighted cigarette shortly before a fire started in his padded cell, causing 27 deaths, the authorities reported today.

title: SUBSTITUTE IN 'TOSCA' HAILED
description: Olivia Stapp, the Metropolitan Opera soprano, scored the kind of success that every young singer dreams about on Monday night when she rushed to the Washington Opera from New York to substitute for the ailing Shirley Verrett in ''Tosca.''

title: CONTINENTAL STEEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
ISRAEL IS SAID TO LINK PULLOUT TALKS WITH NORMALIZING LEBANON TIES
description: Administration officials said today that Israel had refused to begin talks with Lebanon on the withdrawal of Israeli troops from Lebanese territory until the Beirut Government agreed to discuss steps toward political normalization with Israel.

title: WESTERN CASUALTY & SURETY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Q&A
description: Q. I am told that sour salt is acceptable on a salt-free diet. Do you agree?
